text:
Try running some tech checks on your own shots such as:

A difference Merge with the plate (should be black everywhere except your comped or graded elements)

A laplacian or similar to check the grain

Also do a Merge difference between the plate and denoised plate and your comp and a denoised version of your comp. The differences should show you the grain patterns and they should be the same.

Viewing the sequence one quarter at a time.

Exposure up, exposure down, gamma up, gamma down does anything become apparent? Pump up the saturation, does anything become apparent?

Play sequence on a realtime loop and a ping pong. Step through sequence frame by frame and toggle between render and plate.

Spend a good half hour on this, in production this will happen after you get creative final on a shot. Somewhere like Molinare or in Advertising with shorter turnarounds you will just do an abbreviated version yourself (5 minutes or so).

Never send a render you haven't watched through, even if you have checked the comp, even if production are crying out for it. It's like feeding your Mogwai after midnight - it'll bring out the gremlins.
Great tips! Thanks, I will use them in my upcoming projects! :slightly_smiling_face:
For part of my module, I have been asked to interview a industry professional, would you be alright with me just asking you a few questions? It wont be for a few weeks but just giving you a heads up?
